IRS990.ActivityOrMissionDesc: WESTMINSTER PLACE, A FAITH BASED NOT FOR PROFIT, CREATES VIBRANT COMMUNITIES FOR OLDER ADULTS THAT INSPIRE WELLNESS, INDEPENDENCE, JOY AND SECURITY - ENRICHING THE LIVES OF RESIDENTS AND THEIR FAMILIES.
IRS990.MissionDesc: WESTMINSTER PLACE, A FAITH BASED NOT FOR PROFIT, CREATES VIBRANT COMMUNITIES FOR OLDER ADULTS THAT INSPIRE WELLNESS, INDEPENDENCE, JOY AND SECURITY - ENRICHING THE LIVES OF RESIDENTS AND THEIR FAMILIES.
IRS990.Desc: WESTMINSTER PLACE IS A NOT-FOR-PROFIT INDEPENDENT LIVING, LIFE PLAN COMMUNITY (FORMERLY KNOWN AS CONTINUING CARE RETIREMENT COMMUNITY). INDEPENDENT LIVING FACILITY IN WESTMINSTER PLACE CONSISTS OF 237 APARTMENTS, TOWNHOUSES AND COTTAGES. SERVICES PROVIDED BY WESTMINSTER PLACE INCLUDE FLEXIBLE DINING OPTIONS, HOUSEKEEPING AND COMPLETE MAINTENANCE SERVICES, TRANSPORTATION AS WELL AS PLANNED SOCIAL AND EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES AND PROGRAMS. DURING THE FILING YEAR, WESTMINSTER PLACE SERVED 299 INDEPENDENT LIVING RESIDENTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy2Grp.Desc: THE ASSISTED LIVING FACILITY AT WESTMINSTER PLACE PROVIDES ASSISTED LIVING FOR OLDER ADULTS WHO NEEDED ASSISTANCE WITH PERSONAL CARE AND DAILY ACTIVITIES. IT CONSISTS OF 93 STUDIO, ONE AND TWO-BEDROOM APARTMENTS. DURING THE FILLING YEAR, WESTMINSTER PLACE ASSISTED LIVING FACILITY SERVED 106 RESIDENTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActy3Grp.Desc: WESTMINSTER PLACE HEALTH CARE CENTERS PROVIDE INTERMEDIATE AND SKILLED NURSING FOR BOTH SHORT AND LONG TERM STAYS. RESPITE, REHABILITATION, AND PROGRAMS TO CARE FOR THOSE WITH ALZHEIMER'S DISEASE AND OTHER COGNITIVE IMPAIRMENTS ARE ALSO AVAILABLE. THE HEALTH CARE CENTERS INCLUDE 100 SKILLED, MEDICARE-CERTIFIED BEDS AND 95 INTERMEDIATE AND MEMORY CARE BEDS. DURING THE FILING YEAR, THE HEALTH CARE CENTERS SERVED A TOTAL OF 407 RESIDENTS.

ProgSrvcAccomActyOtherGrp.Desc: OTHER PROGRAM SERVICES - REVENUE IS RELATED TO LEASE INCOME FROM RELATED ORGANIZATIONS AND OTHER INCOME.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: PART X, LINE 2:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PRESBYTERIAN HOMES, WESTMINSTER PLACE, AND GENEVA FOUNDATION OF PRESBYTERIAN HOMES FOLLOW THE ACCOUNTING STANDARDS FOR CONTINGENCIES IN EVALUATING UNCERTAIN TAX POSITIONS. THE PARENT, WESTMINSTER PLACE, AND THE FOUNDATION FILE INFORMATIONAL RETURNS AS TAX-EXEMPT ORGANIZATIONS. THE INCOME TAX RETURNS ARE SUBJECT TO REVIEW AND EXAMINATION BY FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: PART I, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TODD F. SWORTZEL RECEIVED A $23,274 TAXABLE HOUSING ALLOWANCE FROM PRESBYTERIAN HOMES (THE SOLE CORPORATE MEMBER OF WESTMINSTER PLACE WHICH IS INCLUDED IN W-2 WAGES.) RAMONA WILT RECEIVED A $791 TAXABLE HOUSING ALLOWANCE FROM PRESBYTERIAN HOMES (THE SOLE CORPORATE MEMBER OF WESTMINSTER PLACE WHICH IS INCLUDED IN W-2 WAGES.)

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: PART I, LINE 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE OF PRESBYTERIAN HOMES (SOLE MEMBER OF WESTMINSTER PLACE) IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ALL COMPENSATION AND BENEFIT MATTERS FOR SENIOR MANAGEMENT AND KEY EMPLOYEES. PRESBYTERIAN HOMES ANNUALLY PARTICIPATES IN AN INDUSTRY SPECIFIC EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION SURVEY. THE RESULTS OF THIS SURVEY ARE REVIEWED BY MANAGEMENT AND SHARED WITH THE COMMITTEE AS NECESSARY. IN ADDITION THE COMMITTEE REGULARLY ENGAGES AN EXTERNAL COMPENSATION CONSULTING FIRM TO ASSIST IN ITS REVIEW OF THE LEVEL OF COMPENSATION, INCENTIVES AND BENEFITS FOR SENIOR EXECUTIVES AND KEY EMPLOYEES EVERY THREE YEARS. THE COMPENSATION CONSULTANTS ACCUMULATE AND PRESENT TO THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE MARKET INFORMATION FOR EACH SENIOR EXECUTIVE POSITION, SUMMARIZE INDIVIDUAL EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION, INCENTIVE AND BENEFITS PACKAGES AND BENCHMARK THAT INFORMATION TO THE INDUSTRY DATA THEY HAVE ACCUMULATED. ANNUALLY, THE ORGANIZATION'S STAFF AND/OR THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PREPARES PERFORMANCE REVIEWS FOR ALL SENIOR MANAGERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES AND MAKES A RECOMMENDATION TO THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE REGARDING COMPENSATION, INCENTIVES AND BENEFITS ADJUSTMENTS. THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE CONSIDERS THE PERFORMANCE RECOMMENDATION, COMPARISONS OF TOTAL COMPENSATION BY EXECUTIVE TO MARKET COMPENSATION PERCENTILE FOR INDUSTRY EXECUTIVES WITH SIMILAR JOB TITLES AND/OR SKILL SETS, AND ORGANIZATIONAL NEEDS IN TERMS OF MEETING THE CHALLENGES OF THE UNIQUE BUSINESS OF PROVIDING SENIOR CARE SERVICES. THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE MAKES A RECOMMENDATION REGARDING COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS CHANGES FOR SENIOR MANAGEMENT WHICH IS APPROVED ANNUALLY BY THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS WITHIN THE BUDGET PROCESS. THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE PROCEEDINGS ARE CONTEMPORANEOUSLY DOCUMENTED AND MINUTES ARE MAINTAINED AND ON FILE AT THE CORPORATE OFFICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: PART I, LINES 4A-B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: PART I, LINE 4A - DURING THE YEAR, DANIEL WEINBERGER RECEIVED A SEVERANCE PAYMENT IN THE AMOUNT OF $26,991. PART I, LINE 4B - PRESBYTERIAN HOMES (SOLE MEMBER OF WESTMINSTER PLACE) HAS ESTABLISHED A NON-QUALIFIED SECTION 457(F) DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN. THE ORGANIZATION'S ACCRUALS INTO THE PLAN ARE RECORDED ON THE 990 AS DEFERRED COMPENSATION. HOWEVER, THESE MONIES VEST OVER A FIVE-YEAR PERIOD AND ARE ONLY ELIGIBLE TO BE RECEIVED BASED UPON THE ACHIEVEMENT OR SATISFACTION OF SOME FUTURE EVENT. THE PLAN CONTRIBUTIONS ARE NOT UNDER THE CONTROL OF THE EXECUTIVE, THEY REMAIN THE ASSET OF THE ORGANIZATION, AND THE ENTIRE PLAN IS SUBJECT TO A FULL RISK OF FORFEITURE BY THE INDIVIDUAL. DURING THE YEAR THE FOLLOWING INDIVIDUALS PARTICIPATED IN A NON-QUALIFIED SECTION 457(F) DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN: TODD SWORTZEL, MARK HAVRILKA, NADIM ABI-ANTOUN, NANCY TOLAN, ANDREW WISSEL, RAMONA WILT, ALPANA PATEL, DANIEL WEINBERGER AND WILLIAM CASPER. DURING THE YEAR TODD SWORTZEL RECEIVED PAYMENTS TOTALING $168,568 FROM A NON-QUALIFIED SECTION 457(F) DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN. DURING THE YEAR NADIM ABI-ANTOUN RECEIVED PAYMENTS TOTALING $40,500 FROM A NON-QUALIFIED SECTION 457(F) DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN. DURING THE YEAR MARK HAVRILKA RECEIVED PAYMENTS TOTALING $39,976 FROM A NON-QUALIFIED SECTION 457(F) DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN. DURING THE YEAR NANCY TOLAN RECEIVED PAYMENTS TOTALING $16,920 FROM A NON-QUALIFIED SECTION 457(F) DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN. DURING THE YEAR ANDREW WISSEL RECEIVED PAYMENTS TOTALING $16,364 FROM A NON-QUALIFIED SECTION 457(F) DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN. DURING THE YEAR DANIEL WEINBERGER RECEIVED PAYMENTS TOTALING $96,198 FROM A NON-QUALIFIED SECTION 457(F) DEFERRED COMPENSATION PLAN. EFFECTIVE APRIL 1, 2021, PRESBYTERIAN HOMES (SOLE MEMBER OF WESTMINSTER PLACE) HAS ESTABLISHED AN EXECUTIVE RETENTION BONUS PROGRAM, A NON-QUALIFIED SECTION 457(F) DEFERRED COMPENSATION AGREEMENT. THE ORGANIZATION'S ACCRUALS INTO THE AGREEMENT ARE RECORDED ON THE 990 AS DEFERRED COMPENSATION. THESE COMPENSATIONS ARE VESTED OVER A FOUR-YEAR PERIOD AND ARE SUBJECT TO EXECUTIVE'S SATISFACTION OF THE TERMS AND CONDITIONS OF THE AGREEMENT. THE CONTRIBUTIONS OF THIS AGREEMENT ARE NOT UNDER THE CONTROL OF THE EXECUTIVE, AND THEY REMAIN THE ASSET OF THE ORGANIZATION. THE ENTIRE AGREEMENT IS SUBJECT TO A FULL RISK OF FORFEITURE BY THE INDIVIDUAL. DURING THE YEAR THE FOLLOWING INDIVIDUALS PARTICIPATED IN THIS RETENTION BONUS PROGRAM: TODD SWORTZEL, NADIM ABI-ANTOUN AND MARK HAVRILKA.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: PART I, LINE 7
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AS INDICATED IN SCHEDULE J, PART II, THE OFFICERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES OF THE ORGANIZATION RECEIVED A BONUS BASED ON PERFORMANCE, CENSUS METRICS AND THE FINANCIAL RESULTS OF THE ORGANIZATION. THIS BONUS WAS APPROVED BY BOARD OF DIRECTORS UPON THE RECOMMENDATION OF THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE.

TaxExemptBondsIssuesGrp.PurposeDesc: TO REFUND THE SERIES 1996A, 2001, 2006 AND 2007 BONDS

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE K, PART I AND II, LINE 3, BOND A:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE 2016 BOND WAS ISSUED FOR THE BENEFIT OF LAKE FOREST PLACE, LLC (A DISREGARDED ENTITY OF PRESBYTERIAN HOMES). TOTAL PROCEEDS FOR THE BOND IS $114,484,316. $14,230,400 OF THE TOTAL PROCEEDS IS ALLOCABLE TO WESTMINSTER PLACE. THE REMAINING PROCEEDS OF $100,253,916 ARE REPORTED ON THE FORM 990, SCHEDULE K OF PRESBYTERIAN HOMES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE K, PART II, LINE 7, BOND A:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TOTAL ISSUANCE COST FOR THE BOND IS $1,817,171. $230,400 OF THE TOTAL COST IS ALLOCABLE TO WESTMINSTER PLACE. THE REMAINING COST OF $1,586,771 IS REPORTED ON THE FORM 990, SCHEDULE K OF PRESBYTERIAN HOMES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE K, PART I AND II, LINE 3, BOND B:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE 2021 BOND WAS ISSUED FOR THE BENEFIT OF LAKE FOREST PLACE, LLC (A DISREGARDED ENTITY OF PRESBYTERIAN HOMES). TOTAL PROCEEDS FOR THE BOND IS $70,917,301. $41,493,781 OF THE TOTAL PROCEEDS IS ALLOCABLE TO WESTMINSTER PLACE. THE REMAINING PROCEEDS OF $29,423,520 ARE REPORTED ON THE FORM 990, SCHEDULE K OF PRESBYTERIAN HOMES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: SCHEDULE K, PART II, LINE 7, BOND B:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: TOTAL ISSUANCE COST FOR THE BOND IS $1,002,040. $476,620 OF THE TOTAL COST IS ALLOCABLE TO WESTMINSTER PLACE. THE REMAINING COST OF $525,420 IS REPORTED ON THE FORM 990, SCHEDULE K OF PRESBYTERIAN HOMES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 1A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL CONSIST OF THE CHAIR, THE VICE CHAIR, THE SECRETARY, THE TREASURER, AND SUCH ADDITIONAL MEMBERS OF THE BOARD AS FROM TIME TO TIME MAY BE DETERMINED BY THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. THE PRESIDENT/CEO SHALL BE A NON-VOTING ATTENDEE AT ALL MEETINGS OF THE COMMITTEE. THE EXECUTIVE COMMITTEE SHALL HAVE AND EXERCISE THE AUTHORITY OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS IN EMERGENCIES WHEN CONVENING THE FULL BOARD IS NOT PRACTICABLE AND SHALL REPORT ITS ACTIONS TO THE BOARD AT THE EARLIEST OPPORTUNITY.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 3
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE ORGANIZATION HAS AN AGREEMENT WITH PRESBYTERIAN HOMES MANAGER, LLC WHO EMPLOYS THE MANAGEMENT TEAM AND MANAGES THE FACILITIES AND PROVIDES A NUMBER OF SERVICES ON A CENTRALIZED BASIS UNDER THE TERMS OF A SEPARATE MANAGEMENT SERVICES AGREEMENT. PURSUANT TO THE MANAGEMENT SERVICES AGREEMENT, THE FEE IS DETERMINED ON AN ANNUAL BASIS BY AGREEMENT BETWEEN PH MANAGER, LLC AND THE ORGANIZATION. TOTAL MANAGEMENT FEES PAID FOR THE YEAR ENDED MARCH 31, 2023 WERE $ 3,579,259, 6.5% OF THE ORGANIZATION'S BUDGETED REVENUES.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 6
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE SOLE CORPORATE MEMBER OF WESTMINSTER PLACE IS PRESBYTERIAN HOMES (EIN 47-1545753).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION A, LINE 7A
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: ARTICLE I, SECTION 4 OF THE BYLAWS INDICATES THAT THE MEMBER (PRESBYTERIAN HOMES) SHALL BE ENTITLED TO ONE VOTE ON EACH MATTER SUBMITTED TO A VOTE OF THE MEMBER. ARTICLE III, SECTION 1 OF THE BYLAWS INDICATES THAT THE NUMBER OF DIRECTORS MAY BE DECREASED TO NOT FEWER THAN THREE (3) OR INCREASED TO ANY NUMBER FROM TIME TO TIME BY THE MEMBER (PRESBYTERIAN HOMES), IN A WRITING SIGNED BY THE MEMBER (PRESBYTERIAN HOMES).

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 11B
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE FORM 990 IS PREPARED BY AN INDEPENDENT ACCOUNTING FIRM, AND IS THEN PRESENTED TO THE AUDIT COMMITTEE, WHICH ACTS AS A REPRESENTATIVE OF THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS FOR REVIEW AND APPROVAL. THIS IS ACCOMPLISHED PRIOR TO THE FILING OF THE FORM 990. THE AUDIT COMMITTEE FORWARDS ITS RECOMMENDATION FOR ACCEPTANCE OF THE FORM 990 TO THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS. COPIES OF THE FORM 990 ARE ALSO FORWARDED TO THE ENTIRE BOARD FOR THEIR REVIEW AND COMMENT PERIOD. THE BOARD THEN ACTS ON THE RECOMMENDATION OF THE AUDIT COMMITTEE PRIOR TO THE 990 BEING FILED WITH THE IRS.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 12C
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: AN EXTENSIVE CONFLICTS OF INTEREST POLICY WAS ADOPTED IN APRIL 2001 AND MOST RECENTLY REVISED IN 2019. THE POLICY DEFINES COVERED FIDUCIARIES AS PERSONS TO WHOM THIS POLICY APPLIES, AND INCLUDES ALL DIRECTORS, OFFICERS, IDENTIFIED KEY EMPLOYEES AND AGENTS OF PRESBYTERIAN HOMES. AN ANNUAL DISCLOSURE FORM IS PROVIDED TO ALL IDENTIFIED COVERED FIDUCIARIES FOR COMPLETION AND RETURN. PRESBYTERIAN HOMES ALSO ASKS ALL COVERED FIDUCIARIES TO PROVIDE DISCLOSURE WHENEVER CONFLICTS OR DUALITIES OF INTEREST ARISE OR ARE SUSPECTED. IN ADDITION, ALL COMMITTEE CHAIRS REMIND DIRECTORS AT ALL MEETINGS OF THE BOARD OR BOARD COMMITTEES TO DISCLOSE ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OR DUALITIES AS ONE OF THEIR ONGOING DUTIES UNDER THE POLICY. COVERED FIDUCIARIES ARE REQUIRED TO DISCLOSE ANY FACTS OR CIRCUMSTANCES THAT MIGHT GIVE RISE TO POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OR DUALITIES. THE PRESIDENT/CEO OR HIS/HER DESIGNEE REVIEWS THE ANNUAL DISCLOSURE STATEMENTS SUBMITTED BY COVERED FIDUCIARIES AND DETERMINE SPECIFICALLY ANY ACTUAL OR POTENTIAL CONFLICTS OR DUALITIES OF INTEREST. THE PRESIDENT/CEO/DESIGNEE SHALL ADVISE THE APPROPRIATE BOARD OR BOARD COMMITTEE CHAIR AND THE AFFECTED COVERED FIDUCIARY(IES) ON THOSE MATTERS FOR WHICH CERTAIN COVERED FIDUCIARIES SHOULD NOT VOTE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION B, LINE 15
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE OF PRESBYTERIAN HOMES IS RESPONSIBLE FOR ALL COMPENSATION AND BENEFIT MATTERS FOR SENIOR MANAGEMENT AND KEY EMPLOYEES. PRESBYTERIAN HOMES ANNUALLY PARTICIPATES IN AN INDUSTRY SPECIFIC EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION SURVEY. THE RESULTS OF THIS SURVEY IS REVIEWED BY MANAGEMENT AND SHARED WITH THE COMMITTEE AS NECESSARY. IN ADDITION THE COMMITTEE REGULARLY ENGAGES AN EXTERNAL COMPENSATION CONSULTING FIRM TO ASSIST IN ITS REVIEW OF THE LEVEL OF COMPENSATION, INCENTIVES AND BENEFITS FOR SENIOR EXECUTIVES AND KEY EMPLOYEES EVERY THREE YEARS. THE COMPENSATION CONSULTANTS ACCUMULATE AND PRESENT TO THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE MARKET INFORMATION FOR EACH SENIOR EXECUTIVE POSITION, SUMMARIZE INDIVIDUAL EXECUTIVE COMPENSATION, INCENTIVE AND BENEFITS PACKAGES AND BENCHMARK THAT INFORMATION TO THE INDUSTRY DATA THEY HAVE ACCUMULATED. ANNUALLY, THE ORGANIZATION'S STAFF AND/OR THE BOARD OF DIRECTORS PREPARES PERFORMANCE REVIEWS FOR ALL SENIOR MANAGERS AND KEY EMPLOYEES AND MAKES A RECOMMENDATION TO THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE REGARDING COMPENSATION, INCENTIVES AND BENEFITS ADJUSTMENTS. THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE CONSIDERS THE PERFORMANCE RECOMMENDATION, COMPARISONS OF TOTAL COMPENSATION BY EXECUTIVE TO MARKET COMPENSATION PERCENTILE FOR INDUSTRY EXECUTIVES WITH SIMILAR JOB TITLES AND/OR SKILL SETS, AND ORGANIZATIONAL NEEDS IN TERMS OF MEETING THE CHALLENGES OF THE UNIQUE BUSINESS OF PROVIDING SENIOR CARE SERVICES. THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE MAKES A RECOMMENDATION REGARDING COMPENSATION AND BENEFITS CHANGES FOR SENIOR MANAGEMENT WHICH IS APPROVED ANNUALLY BY THE FULL BOARD OF DIRECTORS WITHIN THE BUDGET PROCESS. THE GOVERNANCE COMMITTEE PROCEEDINGS ARE CONTEMPORANEOUSLY DOCUMENTED AND MINUTES ARE MAINTAINED AND ON FILE AT THE CORPORATE OFFICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VI, SECTION C, LINE 19
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: THE GOVERNING DOCUMENTS AND FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE UPON REQUEST TO THE PUBLIC. CONTACT FOR THE INFORMATION IS THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER, MARK HAVRILKA AT PRESBYTERIAN HOMES, 8707 SKOKIE BOULEVARD, SUITE 400, SKOKIE, IL 60077. THE FINANCIAL STATEMENTS ARE AVAILABLE THROUGH THE ILLINOIS ATTORNEY GENERAL'S OFFICE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART VII:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: MR. TODD F. SWORTZEL, SERVED AS CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER UNTIL DECEMBER 2022 AND ASSIGNED 80 PERCENT OF HIS TIME TO RELATED ORGANIZATIONS, PRESBYTERIAN HOMES AND THE GENEVA FOUNDATION, AND 20 PERCENT OF HIS TIME TO THE FILING ORGANIZATION, WESTMINSTER PLACE. MR. NADIM ABI-ANTOUN SERVED AS CHIEF OPERATING OFFICER UNTIL DECEMBER 2022 AND STARTED HIS NEW ROLE AS CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER AS OF JANUARY 2023. AS CHIEF OPERATING OFFICER, HE ASSIGNED 65 PERCENT OF HIS TIME TO PRESBYTERIAN HOMES, AND 35 PERCENT OF HIS TIME TO WESTMINSTER PLACE. AS CHIEF EXECUTIVE OFFICER, HE ASSIGNS 70 PERCENT OF HIS TIME TO RELATED ORGANIZATIONS, PRESBYTERIAN HOMES AND THE GENEVA FOUNDATION, AND 30 PERCENT OF HIS TIME TO THE FILING ORGANIZATION, WESTMINSTER PLACE. THE CHIEF FINANCIAL OFFICER ASSIGNS 70 PERCENT OF HIS TIME TO PRESBYTERIAN HOMES AND THE GENEVA FOUNDATION, AND 30 PERCENT OF HIS TIME TO WESTMINSTER PLACE.

SupplementalInformationDetail.FormAndLineReferenceDesc: FORM 990, PART XI, LINE 9:
SupplementalInformationDetail.ExplanationTxt: CAPTIVE MEMBER'S SAVING ALLOCATION 36,668.
